ground_truth_answer: While smartphones can measure a swing's period using accelerometer data to track the sinusoidal motion, this method has both capabilities and limitations. The phone can record the acceleration along the swing chain to determine the period between peaks, which can then be used to calculate the swing's length using the simple pendulum equation. However, this is only an approximation since real swings aren't simple pendulums - they have mass in the chains and the person's body creates a distributed rather than point mass. Additionally, the phone's accelerometer measurements will have some inherent drift and error due to the limitations of inertial sensors.
